definition: loath to part (idiom); emotionally close and unwilling to separate
to give up/to abandon/to give alms

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: She is busy with that boy.
sentences.chinese: 她與那個男孩難捨難分。

sentences.english: The deep love heart hurts, hard to give up.
sentences.chinese: 愛到深處心會痛，難捨難分。

sentences.english: She did not in the least miss him .
sentences.chinese: 她對他一點也不覺得難捨難分。

sentences.english: They were really sexing it up last night.
sentences.chinese: 他們昨夜親熱得難捨難分。

sentences.english: Nor does it stop there. Right into adult life the phenomenon seems to stay with us.
sentences.chinese: 不僅如此，這現象似乎直到成年還和我們難捨難分。

sentences.english: The lovers were exceedingly loath to separate.
Love is too deep wounds, feeling too easily see true so.
sentences.chinese: 愛太深容易看見傷痕，情太真所以難捨難分。

sentences.english: She was only 17 years old and she and Charlie had fallen deeply in love.
sentences.chinese: 她才17歲卻與查理相親相愛，難捨難分。

definition: the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
unswerving in one's loyalty (idiom); faithful and constant
the second person/(fig.) someone else/third party
to make a concession/to be accommodating
lit. to hate iron for not becoming steel/to feel resentful towards sb for failing to meet expectations and impatient to see improvement (idiom)
to revisit old haunts (idiom); down memory lane
to show every possible consideration (idiom); meticulous care
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
